===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=とりい|鳥|tr1=tori|t1=bird|居|tr2=i|t2=[[sitting]]; a [[seat]]}}. From old legends about birds possessed by ''[[kami]]'' and sitting on tree branches.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|と|りい}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[to̞ɾiː]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|とり.い|hhira=とりゐ}}

# a [[torii]]: a symbolic [[gate]] to a [[Shinto]] [[shrine]] or [[Buddhist]] [[temple]]
# a similar [[roofless]] [[gate]] to a [[residence]]
# the [[top]] [[bar]] of a [[railing]]
# the top [[horizontal]] bar of a [[balance]] [[scale]] for [[measure|measuring]] [[weight]]
